website_summaries.verdict: Marketed as "indestructible," it is excellent for heavy, deep work, including the breaking up of dirt clods.
pros: It's very hard to bend this one-piece trowel of high-quality steel
The blade has depth markings, and there is a hand strap (leather) for convenience
cons: Although highly effective, the design is not the traditional trowel blade shape
Customers who want a standard trowel shape may wish to look elsewhere

customer_reviews.title: Sharp edges near handle (easily fixed)
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Solid one piece stainless steel construction Leather lanyard, with metal retention clip Forward (digging edge) is sharpened. The red bicycle grip is very tough, should last a life time. Cons: The edges near the handle are razor sharp. If you are not careful when using this trowel, there is a chance that your hand could slip off the handle, and forward into the sharp edge, resulting in a bad cut. Fix: a very simple solution is to use a file to round over the edges, doesn’t take but more than 2-3 strokes per side. If this issue were fixed, it's a 5-star trowel. Other trowels pictured:
customer_reviews.author: aTypicalEngineer808

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Hand Digging Tool!!!
customer_reviews.text: Had some doubts about a rolled handle but I have NO doubts about this one! I'm going to use this for metal detecting and don't see any issues as far as using it for prying. It's 14" long, 2.75" wide and according to my measurements, the stainless steel barely fits between the lines of 1/16th of an inch which is THICK for a hand digging trowel. The only way I would need another one is if it's lost or stolen! Would never recommend anything else other than this model and brand!!
customer_reviews.author: HKMR762

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: It didn't work for me. The product is high quality. But truly uncomfortable to use. It is too narrow to lift anything properly. Although it is very sharp. The handle is a but slippery even with gloves. If the blade was a tiny bit wider, and hand handle was rubbery and maybe heavier and longer by an inch, I think this product would sell like hot cakes and work better. The blade is the highest quality I have seen, no doubt in that. To me it looks kind of a knife and works better for weeds in narrow area then a trowel.
customer_reviews.author: MommyVixen

customer_reviews.title: ** THE ROLLS ROYCE OF TROWELS!!!! **
customer_reviews.text: Not only can you dig a hole like normal, but if you turn the trowel around so the scoop is facing you, you can swing your arm down hard and the sharp edges will almost effortlessly chop roots (not large ones of course) and hard soil. I bought this for my husband who is too cheap to pay a gardener like everyone else in LA does, but I love it and borrow it for planting tomatoes and the very few other yard chores I do. I used to find it impossible to dig an adequate hole for planting anything. Now it is almost effortless. This is the Rolls Royce of trowels!.
customer_reviews.author: A. Nony MooseTop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: Marvelous gardening tool.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on the many positive reviews already posted. The reviews were glowing about the strength and versatility of this trowel. The glowing reviews were spot on. This trowel really does seem indestructible. I used it on some virgin ground in my yard that was full of embedded rocks and small stones. This little marvel worked wonders in digging a small trench for this area. It displayed no weakness at in while doing this task, which would likely have destroyed the average garden trowel.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Truthteller

customer_reviews.title: Bonnie died :(
customer_reviews.text: This trowel is not a normal trowel. "Bonnie Botanical" (deceased trowel) bit the dust after 15 years . :( My standards were high shopping for her replacement. Now, I loved Bonnie, don't get me wrong. But. "Robert The Rooter" (this trowel) has filled that empty HOLE in my heart. Sturdy,rugged,handsome, big hunk of shiny happiness is now hanging proudly once were Bonnie hung. I'd LOVE to try more of the products.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Very rugged design
customer_reviews.text: All garden trowels always bend and break in exactly the same place. This one doesn't. This definitely falls under the "buy the best tools you can afford" category. Rather than stupidly reducing material in the area between the handle and the blade like most trowels, this elegant design is a simple bend that transitions into a roll, upon which a handle is placed. It retains the material that is usually removed at the high stress point. I love it. If I was in a 90s rap group, I would wear this around my neck. I may just do so anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Edan

customer_reviews.title: Worth It
customer_reviews.text: Well this is the real deal. No wimpy-break -it-in half-the-second-time-you-use-it piece of trash that use so commonly find in garden centres and box stores. This is a class tool. Well made, great grip, well chromed, good metal....some might find it too large perhaps but it fits me fine. Only suggestion to the manufacturer....lose the leather strap.....replace with some good cordage....that leather wont hold up and sends a message not in keeping with the rest of the tool.
customer_reviews.author: go

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: It works well but I wish it were a bit different. I added serrations to the side for cutting through roots (like a hori hori) and I think that makes it a lot more functional. It is a bit heavy and could probably be a bit shorter (14" version). I also wish it had a natural curve so it would be easier to hold. It just feels too linear, like I am using a V shaped chunk of metal instead of an ergo trowel.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Schwartzel

customer_reviews.title: Very good trowel
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, and I like that it was made in the USA. However, I did manage to bend it prying on a root. I don't think that is its intended use, but as a smallish person (5'4", 125lbs), I didn't think I'd be able to bend it. Thankfully it still works well, as opposed to the numerous aluminum trowels I have broken. Apparently I need to go easy on my tools.
customer_reviews.author: Laurel

customer_reviews.title: Sticky
customer_reviews.text: Sticky...sticky...sticky...absolutely a great trowel...and it comes with stickers and tape all over it...
customer_reviews.author: Outside the Pit

customer_reviews.title: Well Made
customer_reviews.text: I have used a number of trowels in the garden over the years. Typically, they bend or break after a while. This one does not. When I lost the one I purchased earlier, I quickly order an identical replacement. It is very sturdy. The blade is stainless steel so it will not rust. As a plus, there are markings on the blade for use when planting flower bulbs at the correct depth. The only "problem" I had with my old one is that the leather loop broke off during an extra hard pull when it got snagged accidentally. But I really didn't miss the loop, so life was still good.
customer_reviews.author: Gregorian Chanter

customer_reviews.title: I really like this trowel
customer_reviews.text: The features I like include the pointed tip of the shovel which makes it easier to break into the dirt. I like the length and overall size which seems optimal for small areas where full-on shoveling would be a bit too much. I can rake dirt around sweeping the surface with the side of the trowel filling holes and building up furrows as needed. The plastic handle is solid and thick enough that I don't expect it to fail anytime soon. The leather strap is helpful for hanging the trowel on my nursery rack. This tool is going to out live me, easy! I'm impressed!
customer_reviews.author: J. Ray

customer_reviews.title: Highly efficient tool that makes your gardening/landscaping much easier.
customer_reviews.text: I have four 20x20 gardens, and plant a variety of veggies. Also, I plant some landscaping sections in my yard. I bought this tool recommended by Wirecutter, and although I was most happy with my previous digger this one looked interesting. After a season of use I can unequivocally and without hesitation give this tool a 5-Star rating. Very easy to use, and highly functional. A couple bucks more than the ones at HD, Lowes, etc, but more than worth it. Looking forward to planting next season.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this is a beautiful tool and well built
customer_reviews.text: No denying it: this is a beautiful tool and well built. My two problems are that 1) the handle needs to be an inch longer and 2) there is no offset between the blade and the handle for extra leverage. I wanted to like it and am outvoted greatly by well-informed gardeners who love it. This is just my disappointed individual reaction.
customer_reviews.author: Js

customer_reviews.title: Best Digging Hand Trowel I Ever Had
customer_reviews.text: I've bought quite a few hand trowels in my 40 years as an adult. This is by far the sharpest trowel I have ever had. Excellent for digging in rocky and clay soil. The sharp edge and narrow but strong scoop works extremely well. Excellend for digging holes for bulbs and plants. Highly recommended. Not really necessary if you have really loose garden soil. Handle does not look terribly comfortable but fits well into my hand. So no complaints with the grip.
customer_reviews.author: SonnyandSam

customer_reviews.title: Love The Wilcox All Pro Trowel!
customer_reviews.text: I bought The Wilcox All Pro 14" Trowel hoping it would be sturdy. The quality is excellent. The front point and edges are sharp which makes it easy to dig through the soil. If a root is in the way, a few hits with the side of the trowel and the roots are cut through. I would definitely buy again although I think this tool will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: ACDC

customer_reviews.title: Love this trowel
customer_reviews.text: This is a workhorse of a trowel. I don’t even pick up my old one anymore. I have lots of little rocks in my soil and it’s still sharp after all my digging thru rocks and soil. I read lots of reviews before ever buying anything on line and then worry about the quality since I can’t touch and see it first...No worries here, I was very happy with the quality of this trowel and how it’s held up.
customer_reviews.author: CyndeeZ

customer_reviews.title: Really Good Trowel
customer_reviews.text: You wouldn't think there'd be much of a difference among trowels, but as a person who's gone through several over the years, I'm here to tell you that this baby is far superior to any I've had and used before. It's sturdy, made of stainless steel, has a vinyl handle that's easy and comfortable to grip, a sharp pointed end that cuts into hard soil with little trouble, and even depth markings on the blade. I'm very happy with this tool, can you tell?
customer_reviews.author: Flem Snopes

customer_reviews.title: This is a great trowel, especially if you have hard, clay soil
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally threw my old, sturdy trowel out and hated the carbon one in bought to replace it. My mother had purchased this because an avid gardener friend recommended it. The shape of the trowel and the sharp point make it much easier to dig in our hard, clay soil. The handle makes it comfortable to use and gives you good leverage, and it feels sturdy enough to las a long time. I think it is definitely worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: L. Williams

customer_reviews.title: The Big Boss of Trowels
customer_reviews.text: This is the boss! I call it my excavator. I actually have to be careful weeding with this thing, because it can damage the roots of surrounding plants. It's so easy to shove deep into my sandy Florida soil and get out the roots of weeds I've been battling for years. I would like to point out that it has a lovely orange red handle so that it never gets lost while I move around. It is very easy to use. You know the saying, all you gardeners out there: A good workman deserves good tools. Treat yourself to this dude to help all that labor go easier.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Ann Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: I used this to uncover some oak roots that were pulling up my neighbors brick pavers. This shovel is solidly built. South Florida soil is full of coral rocks so it's pretty hard to get through. This shovel held it's edge and shape after using it to stab and pry its way into the ground. I was shocked how unaffected it was. I definitely do not regret the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nik

customer_reviews.title: No More Bending
customer_reviews.text: Bending, as in handle bending when trying to dig a hole. We could start a rock quarry here. You can't dig 2 inches without hitting rocks and bending the handles over. This Trowel has made it through the Summer with lots of digging and planting. It digs right in and handles rocks of all sizes, that I could lift out. Well worth the money. The handle is still straight with no wear.
customer_reviews.author: Lots2Loosea

customer_reviews.title: Built like it's meant to last
customer_reviews.text: I really like this trowel and the fact it is made in the USA. Fantastic quality and a super strong, simple design that will last for years to come. Only thing I see as needing to be replaced in the future would possibly be the grip, but only if you left it out for the sun for years to deteriorate. I imagine a bicycle handgrip could easily be used as a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Derk

customer_reviews.title: Best hand trowel ever -not even close
customer_reviews.text: I'm in my gardens ( about 3/4 acre) just about every day. This trowel is great for digging, weeding, transplanting, furrowing and general use. I've broken and re-welded my Corona trowels so many times there's no metal left. This one is totally un breakable. It's also made in the USA. Gardeners are patriots and we buy American.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Plewnarz

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The tip does not seem strong, It arrived crushed and perhaps a little warped. On the other hand, it is very heavy. Have only used it to transfer potting soil so far--that's when I noticed the tip. I'll probably just file the tiny bit of crushed tip off and see how it does... If it is as flexible as it seems, I don't expect much now.
customer_reviews.author: AHK

customer_reviews.title: This trowel won't bend
customer_reviews.text: I kept going through garden trowels on a regular basis because they would bend either in the shovel or in the handle. Then I saw this one on Amazon and bought it in the hopes it would be the answer to my dilemma. I cannot bend this trowel, it digs, it chops, I throw it into the ground like a knife and it sticks!!. I love this trowel...and, even better, so does my wife.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Garling

customer_reviews.title: Great for metal detecting.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for metal detecting, and it works really well. I simply sharpen the front of the trowel, and drive it into the ground making a U shape and then pop out a little plug about the size of a softball. I can even make bigger plugs for deeper targets as well. When digging all i can is use the tip, drive it in the hole a inch or two and turn, the dirt loosen up and i remove it using my hand. It is a really strong trowel as well. Fits in the pouch i picked up from Lowe's nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Makes Garden work easy.  Will not break.
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a sturdy well-made tool to replace the cheap junk that is being made - and I found this! Most tools are too small - not made for men. Also, the tools are getting more and more flimsy - many breaking after one or just a few times of use. This tool is outstanding. A heavy-duty tool made for men. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Arthur A McCaffrey

customer_reviews.title: Hefty and solid trowel, can't ask for more!
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking high and low for a trowel that can stand daily abuse in a plant nursery. This is it!! No more broken trowels, this thing is hefty and solid and can move dirt like it's nobody's business. As an added bonus it's made in the USA and at a reasonable price!! I am looking forward to getting more of these for the nursery and look forward to checking out the rest of the Wilcox lineup.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Nani

customer_reviews.title: I own the shorter 11" version and love it! I needed a little more digging depth ...
customer_reviews.text: I own the shorter 11" version and love it! I needed a little more digging depth and said I had to have it. This is a must have tool. Don't waste your money on cheap trowel, this one is one that will last to past down you your children and grandchildren.
customer_reviews.author: L. Bogdon

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the junk you find in most stores.
customer_reviews.text: The trowel is well made, durable, effective, and even made in the USA. The 14" length helps to improve leverage, and the tip digs through dirt easily. I liked mine enough that I bought one for my mother as a birthday present ( she's become an even more avid gardener since she retired.) Pros: Made IN USA Durable Effective Well Made Cons It costs twice as much as a cheapo trowel from a garden center, so if you only need something cheap for a very small job ( potting a houseplant for example), it is really more trowel than you need, especially if you are on a tight budget.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction
customer_reviews.text: I needed a sturdy trowel for digging out deep roots while weeding and after a bit of research came across this trowel. It definitely does the trick. It feels solid and strong without being too heavy and I don't have to worry about it getting dented or bent out of shape. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: The overall best garden trowel I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: Okay I know this is just a trowel, and on what may appear on the expensive side, but it is the best single garden trowel I have ever used. You take for granted how much a well designed tool of quality construction can make tasks easier until you grab a cheap big box store one and then it hits you. I got tired of having to share mine with my wife, so I now own two. If you're an avid gardner, you will appreciate this simple tool. It's made here in the USA and there is zero possibility of it ever braking.
customer_reviews.author: Organic Gardener

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Tool
customer_reviews.text: This is the best hand trowel I have ever purchased. It is very sturdy and after a year of heavy use, still looks new. It has great weight, can dig with limited effort and has a handle that is comfortable on my hand. I have multiple sizes of this companies trowels and love all three.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: 2 years and going strong!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely adore this tool. It is my go-to for everything. Digging holes to take out big weeds or plants, breaking up hard soil, checking planting depth, even scraping across the ground as a mini-hoe. If I am going to wander around the yard with one tool instead of my whole tool bag, this is the one!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Johnson

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome trowel! Certainly the best one I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome trowel! Certainly the best one I've ever used. I've bent probably 5 trowels in the 10 years I've been gardening because my soil is very heavy and I'm perhaps a little rough on my tools. But this baby is so strong and sturdy, I can foresee it lasting me forever. Probably if it ever breaks the part that breaks will be the handle, since it's plastic. I would love to see this with a wooden handle. Another perk about this trowel is that it comes with a slight edge on the blade, so it works great at cutting through weeds and roots too. I highly recommend it to anyone having problems with trowels bending.
customer_reviews.author: Jewelsie

customer_reviews.title: Strong and Capable
customer_reviews.text: This is one tough, strong, capable digging tool. It's stainless steel too for "anti-rustness". Its end is just the right amount of sharpness, just enough to dig but not cut off a finger. It can stab at the ground and dig unlike any other similar tools I have. I love the length. This is the best planter trowell digger I have ever come across, thank you Wilcox! MADE IN USA!!! I am updating my review, I used it for weeding violets that are spreading beyond their area and this tool was perfect as a weeder, also.
customer_reviews.author: markld

customer_reviews.title: digging tool
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for scooping out deeper holes when metal detecting. I have a digging trowel with a very pointed end and it works fine and is easy to push into the grass or dirt but after you get down below 4" it becomes difficult to fish the hidden treasure up -- always trying to keep the holes as small as possible, right? -- this tool then comes into play with its blunt nose, more like a scoop you go into the predug hole and pull up your treasure on the first try, nearly every time.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Baxley

customer_reviews.title: Best Trowel Ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the best general purpose garden trowel I've ever used. I've owned the same one for over four years and it's still going strong. There's a smaller version good for more dainty stuff but I prefer this one for most things. Bonus: It's made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: R.S.

customer_reviews.title: Gnarly tools
customer_reviews.text: I now own 3 different sizes of these Wilcox trowels. I plant commercial annual flower beds for a living.
customer_reviews.author: SilentFlight

customer_reviews.title: Best hand shovel ever!
customer_reviews.text: I don't think I can bend this one. I always ruin every hand shovel i own, not this one. Also digs more dirt out of your hole, and does work easier. Great price, quality, (real stainless I think?) Side note: works great to create space to repair/replace sprinklers!
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Excellent! Only one I've owned that hasn't broken.
customer_reviews.text: Ive used this for a couple years now to do any hand digging as an electrician. It is a very strong one piece design that I abuse to no end with no breaks or bends. I had a few others in the past that didn't last even a few hard uses. I pry up rocks, hammer on it, mix cement with it and show it no mercy. When I'm done a job I wash it with water and its good as new. 100% recommend for professional use.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Greatest quality that lasts
customer_reviews.text: Greatest gardening tool I have ever owned. A comfortable pleasure to use, extremely sturdy and no signs of bending or weakness after doing my worst to some very tough weeds. Sharp edge. Broke two trowels before this one and it's holding up wayyy longer. Basically the greatest, buy it and you'll be pleased as well. Made in USA.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and balanced in the hand
customer_reviews.text: A top quality tool. Heavy enough to add heft when digging in compacted soil, with sharp point and edges to deal with roots and such. Comfortable and balanced in the hand. Seems virtually indestructible. I plan to have it as my go-to for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: T. Holland

customer_reviews.title: Looks like it will last a lifetime
customer_reviews.text: It's a beast of a trowel. After breaking a few standard trowels, I paid the premium for this, and so far after one season it feels like a hand shovel that will last decades. If this helped, please click the helpful button below, thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Bill in MassachusettsTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Best Trowel I’ve Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: I sadly lost my Smith and Hawkins trowel and thought I’d never be able to find something as good. Well, I was wrong and in fact the Wilcox trowel is even better! I ordered the 14” trowel and it seems the perfect size for digging in the garden and does a great job of getting under the roots of weeds. It’s longer and narrower than my old trowel and I find I have more power. I think I’ll get the smaller size trowel for the front side of my house. One of the reviews says the 9" is even better for weeds.
customer_reviews.author: K. Orlan

customer_reviews.title: Buy this and you'll get a great trowel and help keep jobs in America!
customer_reviews.text: I love my trowels and tend to loose a few a year (leaving them on the ground or covering them with piles of dirt/rocks then throwing in the wheelbarrow). First, I love that it is made in the USA!! The price is lower than what I've paid for cheap imported tools and it is very sturdy. Most trowels I have bought bend under pressure. Not this one! And the leather cord makes it handy to carry around my wrist (so I don't set it down and lose it) and makes it easy to hang on the pegboard. Buy this and you'll get a great trowel and help keep jobs in America!
customer_reviews.author: amy hunter

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gift
customer_reviews.text: A great tool. If you are a gardener or know one or more, this is the perfect replacement for all those bent and rusting ones in the bottom of your gardening tote! It is a little large for smaller hands but the quality is worth the slight extra effort to hold it.
customer_reviews.author: Mackie74

customer_reviews.title: Wilcox 14" trowel review
customer_reviews.text: I purchased both a 10" & this 14" Wilcox trowel. this one is great for planting although it's big and for some may be a bit cumbersome. My partner has said she likes the smaller 10" better due only to the size of her hands and how she goes about her gardening work. It is a very well made trowel. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Pedersen

customer_reviews.title: Great, inexpensive metal detecting trowel
customer_reviews.text: I use this for metal detecting. The blade is very strong and sharp-ish,it can easily be used to quickly dig out a hole, chop up the dirt to look for items, scrape away the sides of holes, etc. The blade is a good 8 inches (I say this from memory) and with little pressure will slice straight down through the earth. I've only used this in forest settings so I can't speak to beaches or other locations.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: last digger you will need
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a solid piece of metal, maybe you could bend it if you tried, but it would be hard. Works like a champ for rooting around, thinking about getting a smaller one, I'm impressed with just how solid this thing is.
customer_reviews.author: J A

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic heavy duty garden trowel
customer_reviews.text: I have broken every other garden trowel that I have used. Most are lightweight and will not tolerate hard soil such as clay. I saw this and had to have it. It is definitely "Fantastic". I gave it a hardy workout prior to posting a review. Love this garden trowel.
customer_reviews.author: james m. raby

customer_reviews.title: Wife keeps stealing it.
customer_reviews.text: For all the grief I get about "using her tools and not putting them back," she keeps taking this and not leaving it where I left it. I am very happy with this trowel. Best one we have ever had. Came in handy when putting in a paver patio this past spring, the guy helping me with the patio commented on how much he liked it as well. Definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: maihem

customer_reviews.title: Best Garden Tools
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and performance. The best out there at almost any price.
customer_reviews.author: william  jordan

customer_reviews.title: Last trowel you will ever need
customer_reviews.text: This trowel is amazing and so sturdy, sharp and comfortable to use. I highly recommend Wilson garden tools. They are worth every penny. I've destroyed every other brand that I have used - but not this one.
customer_reviews.author: No where mam

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy design fairly priced
customer_reviews.text: Good value for specialty shovel. Excellent for planting flowers or bulbs in prepared beds. I wanted the one with a serrated blade down one side but it was 2.5x the price. Able to get a separate tool for less. Otherwise nice long shovel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A spade to last a lifetime
customer_reviews.text: Nothing else out there compares. It will never break, it will never rust, someday it will belong to your great grandchildren. It's so inexpensive for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan S

customer_reviews.title: A must have for gardeners
customer_reviews.text: I have a bad back and I couldn't use a shovel to dig holes for my hundred plus plants this year. After reading reviews, I decided to give this trowel a try. Our soil is has many stones and large size rocks. The sturdy Wilcox All Pro Trowel handled the job with some help from my CobraHead Weeder. If you need a trowel and tired of them falling apart mid project, I recommend you try this Trowel.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmma

customer_reviews.title: Versatile tool
customer_reviews.text: After long deliberation, I purchased the 14" version. It is stout and removes weeds well. I can use it to plant plugs and small pots. The unitized construction avoids loose handles.
customer_reviews.author: William Moll

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: This trowel is much sturdier than any of my other trowels, and the long narrow blade allows provides a lot of leverage even for digging out rocks and stones. The one-piece construction should ensure that the handle does not bend or break off
customer_reviews.author: PB

customer_reviews.title: Great garden trowel
customer_reviews.text: Great trowel. We have fabric down to prevent weeds and this trowel is sharp enough to dig close to the fabric’s edge with no difficulty. I like the handle. Will likely use for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Lesli L. Wright-bobholz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for metal detecting use.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use as a digger for metal detecting and it is perfect. There is no need to get anything heavier or stronger. The lighter weight is great and this thing is strong and it can cut into the ground like any other (if not better). There is almost no way you can break it unless you go gorilla on it. This would be perfect for gardening or digging up smaller items.
customer_reviews.author: NJ Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy for digging up bulbs.
customer_reviews.text: This is a single piece of solid steel, unlike many of the others available that are steel attached to plastic handles. I use this to dig up garden bulbs and the plastic ones keep breaking when you use them for leverage. So far so good with this one!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Hugginkiss

customer_reviews.title: Thick strong steel, plastic handle, made in USA
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality construction, I have gone through a variety of brands 'Made in China' so I wanted to find something well made. I have very hard clay and so far this trowel is working fantastic. I also purchased another tool from the same brand and it is some serious steel. My only concern is that the handle is made with plastic and I suspect it will be the first thing to go.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph E. Gregory

customer_reviews.title: great garden trowel
customer_reviews.text: This trowel is big enough to work well for transplanting, long and sharp for digging, and comfortable to use. I'm delighted with it and use it frequently in my garden.
customer_reviews.author: Evenwilliam

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous!
customer_reviews.text: I had never seen a trowel shaped like this before, but the recommendations were right! the pointy end makes it perfect for weeding my vegetable garden without leaving roots behind. It's also great for harvesting carrots without breaking them.
customer_reviews.author: Marjorie

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: This is a very strong and sturdy tool, far stronger than any I've owned, and that's saying a lot. This trowel may well outlast me. I'm also pleased by the look of the stainless steel.
customer_reviews.author: Emryld333

customer_reviews.title: Best trowel you can buy
customer_reviews.text: This is a lifetime tool. You'll use it all the time and you wonder how you did without it. The design of this trowel is superb, and allows it to be used for many purposes. I use it for scooping, spreading, digging, cutting through roots, opening bags of soil/manure, edging, and transplanting sod. The construction is simple, strong as heck, and comfortable to use. I highly recommend this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby L Manuel

customer_reviews.title: Red handle
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and I like gardening tools with bright red handles, if you set them down they are easy to locate afterwards. I use this a lot it is extremely efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret A McDermott

customer_reviews.title: .Amazingly strong, sturdy trowel.
customer_reviews.text: This trowel is a bit large but extremely sturdy. Dug pure clay from around a drainage pipe and it was perfect for the job. Never had such a well built, strong trowel.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Adams-Cover

customer_reviews.title: Superb design allows for a great US-made tool at a nice price
customer_reviews.text: Perfect example of US ingenuity. A very simple design with first rate materials means they can still make it in the USA and not charge an arm or a leg. Very sturdy and will last forever with the solid stainless-steel one-piece design. The only criticism is a hand-grip straight off of a 60 year-old kids bike. Many newer designs have nicer handles, but it doesn't really matter if you are wearing work gloves. Who would garden with bare hands? Not me...
customer_reviews.author: I Like to Buy US Products...

customer_reviews.title: A Garden Trowel That Works
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this trowel to replace a locally purchased stainless steel trowel that bent significantly when I tried to remove a weed, root and all, from my clay soil. On my first use, this trowel worked perfectly on a large and long rooted weed, without any change in its appearance or functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Lou. S

customer_reviews.title: Well made in USA!
customer_reviews.text: This tool is wonderful for getting really deep and close to weed roots so as not to disturb other vegetation. Also great for digging narrow planting holes for annuals. I can my gardening jobs done much faster with this well made digger. I love that it's made so well and in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: azn123

customer_reviews.title: Shiny and robust. Also, pointy.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is extremely robust. Also very pointy. I've used it to plant bulbs (some of which are probably even alive), and also to dig out invasive plants from my yard, and it handles both tasks very well. If something happened to mine, I would not hesitate to replace it with the same thing. It's absolutely the perfect tool for this job.
customer_reviews.author: frank

customer_reviews.title: Built like a tank
customer_reviews.text: I was sick of my garden tools falling apart after a year of use. Then I got this beast. It will likely be the last hand shovel I ever buy.
customer_reviews.author: Shane A

customer_reviews.title: Bomb Proof Trowel
customer_reviews.text: I am writing this review because this large trowel is really special. It is heavy duty like a 57 Chevy is compared to a Ford Escort. This trowel is simple and effective for any type of ground. The company that sells it sent it right away and with good packaging. This is one of those rare products that is worth a lot more than it's selling price.
customer_reviews.author: D. Sweet

customer_reviews.title: Big buddy
customer_reviews.text: It's big but I love this thing. We have hard clay soil and shale layers and this has been great for splitting and transplanting small perennials. I have literally leaned my entire body weight on it while it was in a clay hole on a hill and there is no bend. It is sturdy as all get out! There are times I feel like the smaller ones are a bit sharper....but this is my workhorse. I don't know what I ever did without it in my garden.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla C.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Clay Soil
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tool upon the recommendation of my sister. I have a heavy clay-based soil which the angled tip easily cuts into. The blade is long (9 1/2"), so digging deeper holes takes less effort than with a shorter handled trowel. It's pointy tip is also effective for removing weeds like crabgrass and plantain.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Marie

customer_reviews.title: This is the 2nd best trowel I've ever owned (I like the Wilcox 12" ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd best trowel I've ever owned (I like the Wilcox 12" trowel better - but use both). I was a bit apprehensive over the price. . . but it's nice to finally have a tool that I'm more likely to lose than break. . . and I'm going to be careful not to lose it because it works so good!
customer_reviews.author: AbsoluteRock

customer_reviews.title: Solid strong useful trowel
customer_reviews.text: We have rocks everywhere in yard. This trowel is sturdy enough to hold up. Have had others that bend. Nice to have measurements on trowel to know depth of hole. Good thing is won't need another trowel.
customer_reviews.author: Tom T

customer_reviews.title: I may never need to buy another trowel
customer_reviews.text: This thing is sturdy as heck. It's clearly marked, and the handle is comfortable. Finally, a trowel that isn't going to bend where the handle joins the tool.
customer_reviews.author: Jen M

customer_reviews.title: gardening essential!
customer_reviews.text: We were so happy we added these trowels last fall to our 2015 market gardening bin- this tool works! Do NOT bother to go to your big box store for this- it will not be there. This almost feels like a Cutco tool, and that would be the standard to beat for quality cutting. It is a bit large, but for transplants, it is the bomb.
customer_reviews.author: MMC

customer_reviews.title: Wilcox all pro
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to loosen soil for carrot in green house. Very sturdy. I might have to buy another as a spare.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Solid Made in USA product that I will be using for many more years
customer_reviews.text: There is not a lot of negative to say about this trowel. It is made out of a heavy single piece metal blank. Effectively rolled, shaped and the groove added for additional strength. At the price, this is an awesome tool. If I could change one thing about it, I'd consider the handle, which I personally would want to be wood. Given a wood handle, the price would have to go up as well. Overall, I am completely satisfied and happy with this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Zaydel

customer_reviews.title: Built to last
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. I won’t have to worry about buying one of these again for a long time. It is definitely built to last. Thank you, my fellow Americans for making a quality product. Can you tell an Asian American is writing this?
customer_reviews.author: SCheek

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Trowel for the Tough Jobs
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a trowel that was strong and wouldn't bend or break. This trowel fits that perfectly. It has a very solid construction and is remarkably strong. Also, it is very sharp, which is important when digging in dense, hard clay.
customer_reviews.author: bonnie_blu

customer_reviews.title: Well made, high quality.
customer_reviews.text: We use these for planting pineapple on our Hawaii farm. We plant 10,000 per year. The oldest trowel we have is 5 years old now and looks almost as good as new, even in Hawaii's highly corrosive environment.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: IT IS SO SOLID.
customer_reviews.text: IT IS SO SOLID. My only complaint is the coating on the handle has a factory flaw at the top, but it doesn't make a difference in using it. This thing can dig in and handle all the nonsense without blinking. Longer than I expected when I got it, but that's even better. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Adams

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: I love this trowel. It is sharp to cut small root, long enough to dig deep, large enough to scoop good amount of material.
customer_reviews.author: larry

customer_reviews.title: Indestructible, built far above and beyond anything close
customer_reviews.text: When your budget allows you to buy something that you will own for the rest of your life, you buy it, and this is that thing, a trowel that will last you the rest of your years.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: I am a horrible tool caretaker
customer_reviews.text: I am a horrible tool caretaker. This thing is indestructible. I have left it outside in various weather conditions (for weeks), never cleaned it, worked it with heavy clay, stepped on it a few dozen times, and used it as a hammer plateau to drive down stakes into the ground. It's been taking this abuse like a champ. This review was written out of guilt for how I treat it and not cause I received any benefit.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Basically a tiny sword.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mom. She loves it, but she wishes it wasn't so sharp at the end. Personally, I love the sharp end but she was afraid the tip would "cut her composting worms in half". It's basically a tiny sword/shovel. I love that it's all one piece with a rubber handle. We've purchased so many of the Dollar Tree gardening shovels that snap in half, this one will not have that issue.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Super quality
customer_reviews.text: Longer than my previous trowel, at first I wasn't sure I wanted one this long - but after using it a few times, it works like a small shovel, and I'm glad I got this size. Solid, pretty sure this will never break or even bend
customer_reviews.author: Mark52

customer_reviews.title: Best trowel for the money
customer_reviews.text: These are great trowels. They are sturdy without being excessively heavy and no rust or bending in the middle.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Bailey

customer_reviews.title: is comfortable to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid product. I've had issues in the past with trowels bending when digging in the heavy clay common to my region. Due to the design of this trowel, it stands up to some very tough conditions, is comfortable to use, even when it gets wet, and has handy markings to check depth easily. I was concerned about the size, as it looks a bit small in pictures, but it is a very good size for a variety of general garden uses.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had bought this one three small shovels ago!
customer_reviews.text: This is very tough and well worth the extra few bucks on the price. Deep dandelions don't stand a chance!
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: strong and sharp
customer_reviews.text: I have had problems with trowels bending and wanted something that I couldn't break. This fits the bill. It's sturdy, rust-free, and has a durable (non-foam) handle grip. The edges are a little sharp — I'd prefer they were smoothed down in the vicinity of the handgrip, but that's a small quibble. I bought a second for my mom for her birthday.
customer_reviews.author: sempervirens

customer_reviews.title: Amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Absalutely amazing . no more cheap tools from lowes or the depot or TSC . these will be around for years.
customer_reviews.author: matthew garvey

customer_reviews.title: It's about time
customer_reviews.text: It's about time someone made a decent garden trowel. We seem to buy 1-2 trowels a year, I honestly believe we won't need another for at least 10 years, maybe longer. This is stamped out of heavy gauge stainless steel so it's built to last, There is no way anyone could bend it unless you put a longer handle on it. I had to dig out behind our pond skimmer & was able to pry out rocks with it, just the perfect trowel.
customer_reviews.author: STL Ken

product_meta.title: Wilcox All Pro 202S Trowel, 14", Stainless Steel
product_meta.description: Size:14"Wilcox rugged garden trowels built to last! built from a singlepiece of 16 Gauge metal, these heavy duty trowels are built to last. The sharp pt. & beveled edges pierce into the Hardest & rockiest of soils. Great for bulb planting, breaking up heavy soils, & general use. Trowels feature depth markings on the blade, plastic grip, & leather hand strap.
feature_bullets: Works very well for deep bulb planting & breaking up stubborn clods
No fear of bending or breaking due to high quality Stainless Steel design
Stainless Steel. Made in the USA.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.9 out of 5 stars660 ratings4.9 out of 5 stars
